alert.note: Alert for Caddo; De Soto (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 07 at 8:32PM CDT until further notice by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Louisiana... Cypress Bayou At Wallace Lake affecting De Soto and Caddo Parishes. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is currently forecast. * WHERE...Cypress Bayou At Wallace Lake. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 149.0 feet, Expect some minor lowland flooding with overflow beginning to affect some secondary roadways around the southern Kingston Road area. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CDT Friday the stage was 151.0 feet. - Forecast...The lake is forecast to crest at 152.0 feet Saturday evening. The lake will slowly fall below flood stage by the middle of next week. - Flood stage is 151.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 150.1 feet on 01/12/1968. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 9:00 AM CDT.
